title: daemon-logs: Implement log rotation for daemon logs
description:
To support long-running daemon processes and prevent disk space issues, implement log rotation for daemon logs.

**Requirements:**
1. Implement log rotation in daemon based on file size (e.g., 10MB)
2. Keep configurable number of log files (e.g., 5 files)
3. Compress old log files to save space
4. Add log levels (DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR)
5. Timestamp all log entries
6. Ensure structured logging format for better parsing

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Logs rotate when reaching size limit
- [ ] Old logs are compressed (.gz extension)
- [ ] Configurable number of retained logs
- [ ] Log levels are respected in output
- [ ] No log data loss during rotation
- [ ] Works with the logs command streaming

title: cli-prs: Add real-time pairing status monitoring
description:
The navisai pair command currently doesn't monitor pairing progress in real-time. Implement WebSocket-based real-time pairing status updates to show users when devices connect, accept pairing, or fail.

**Requirements:**
1. Connect to daemon's WebSocket endpoint after initiating pairing
2. Listen for pairing-related events (device.connect, device.paired, pairing.failed)
3. Display status updates in real-time in the CLI
4. Show QR code that updates with pairing status
5. Handle timeout scenarios gracefully
6. Allow cancelling the monitoring with Ctrl+C

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Shows 'Waiting for device...' after pairing starts
- [ ] Displays real-time updates when device scans QR code
- [ ] Shows 'Pairing successful!' when device accepts
- [ ] Shows error messages for failed pairings
- [ ] Can cancel monitoring with Ctrl+C
- [ ] Updates every 2 seconds with current status

title: daemon-mdns: Ensure mDNS service record publishing
description:
Documentation mentions publishing _navisai._tcp.local service records via Bonjour. Verify and ensure the daemon properly publishes these service records.

**Requirements:**
1. Check if daemon publishes _navisai._tcp.local PTR record
2. Verify NavisAI._navisai._tcp.local SRV record points to navis.local:443
3. Ensure TXT records include version=1 and tls=1
4. Test service discovery with Bonjour browser tools
5. Verify on mobile devices (iOS/Android) can discover Navis

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Service records are published on daemon start
- [ ] Bonjour service discovery tools show NavisAI service
- [ ] Mobile devices can see NavisAI service
- [ ] Service updates when daemon restarts
- [ ] Records have correct TTL (2 hours)
- [ ] Includes all required TXT entries

title: daemon-ws: Add log events over WebSocket
description:
To support real-time log streaming in the CLI, implement log events that are sent over the WebSocket connection.

**Requirements:**
1. Add 'log' event type to WebSocket message types
2. Stream log entries as they are written to file/console
3. Include log level, timestamp, and message
4. Buffer logs for WebSocket clients that connect late
5. Allow filtering by log level via query params
6. Rate limit to prevent flooding

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Log events are emitted over WebSocket
- [ ] CLI receives real-time log updates
- [ ] Each log entry includes level, timestamp, message
- [ ] Recent logs are buffered for new connections
- [ ] Log level filtering works (e.g., ?level=error)
- [ ] No performance impact on daemon operation
